Info.Description: This module describes the Common Data elements and Macros forScoliosis Pediatric

NumericDataElement.Label: Cobb Angle
NumericDataElement.Hint: Measure coronal plane deformity on anteroposterior plane radiographs in the classification of scoliosis. Units: degrees.

NumericDataElement.Label: Pelvic Tilt
NumericDataElement.Hint: Angle between the iliac crest to the horizontal. Units: degrees.

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Risser Score
MultiChoiceDataElement.Hint: Grade skeletal maturity based on the level of ossification and fusion of the iliac crest apophyses

Choice.Label: 0: No ossification center at the level of iliac crest apophysis
1: Apophysis along <25% of the iliac crest
2: Apophysis along 25-50% of the iliac crest
3: Apophysis along 50-75% of the iliac crest
4: Apophysis along >75% of the iliac crest
5: Complete ossification and fusion of the iliac crest apophysis

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Triradiate Cartilage
MultiChoiceDataElement.Hint: Epiphyseal plate between the ilium, ischium,and pubis to form the acetabulum of the os coxae

NumericDataElement.Label: Pelvic Incidence
NumericDataElement.Hint: Angle of incidence is the algebraic sum of 2 complementary angles: pelvic tilt and sacral slope. Units: degrees.

NumericDataElement.Label: Sagittal Vertical Axis
NumericDataElement.Hint: Sagittal offset of a plumb line dropped from the C7 vertebral body from the posterosuperior corner of the sacral plate. Units: mm

NumericDataElement.Label: Lumbar Lordosis Angle
NumericDataElement.Hint: Anterior convexity of the lumbar spine in the midsagittal plane. Units: degrees.

MultiChoiceDataElement.Label: Scoliosis Type
MultiChoiceDataElement.Hint: Classify the scoliosis type, which is required information for ICD-10
